options.question: 512 MB is the sum of the memory requirements of all the applications you can keep running.
512 MB is enough if the applications in use require: 80MB, 110MB, 100MB, 10MB and 300MB respectively.
512 MB is a sufficient amount of memory if we want to keep running 10 applications that consume 51.2 MB each.
If we start a 100MB application, the memory can keep it open and have 415MB of free space.

initMessages: Among the functions of RAM memory is being able to manage the opening and execution of applications in a fluid way.
RAM memory has a capacity in gigabytes that determines the number of applications it can keep running.
Determine if the statements below are true or false based on the capacity of your RAM memory.
name: RAM
